page.title: 16 THE ELDERLY - HOLLY COURT
page.content: Holly Court is a private home for the elderly built in 1972. It was financed by the Anchor Housing Association and has a Warden and 38 tenants. Each tenant has their own bedsit room and there is a separate lounge with cooking facilities. There is also a guest room so that friends or family can visit. There are social activities such as bingo, coffee mornings, and sing-songs. A well equipped laundry room is heavily used and constant hot water is supplied from the boiler room. Safety is always a priority and Mrs. Platt, the Warden contacts each tenant by intercom between 9am. and 9.30am every day. The tenants suggested that the children might want to put their names down because the waiting list was so long ! {St. Thomas's C.E. Primary
